answerText: axiom of choice[10] Axioms of this type assert the existence of sets that are larger than any set that can be shown to exist in ZFC. These axioms form a hierarchy, near the bottom of which lies the Grothendieck universe axiom.
heading: ACF Regionals 2014 |2014 | J Sergeant Reynolds-Ohio State-St. Johns | 3 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] This axiom asserts that the product of any collection of non-empty sets is also non-empty, and is added to the Zermelo-Fraenkel axioms to give ZFC, the usual foundation of mathematics.
